alert.note: Alert for Sullivan (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 1:01PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Sullivan County through 145 PM EDT... At 101 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Windsor, or 8 miles north of Claremont, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Claremont, Lebanon, Charlestown, Enfield, Newport, Grantham, Cornish, Croydon, Springfield, Plainfield and Sunapee. This includes Interstate 89 between mile markers 38 and 48. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
